name: Glutenfree Lemon Blueberry Waffles
description: These easy vegan gluten-free Lemon Blueberry Waffles are crispy on the outside, light and fluffy on the inside and perfect for brunch or breakfast! Super simple to make in one bowl. Makes 6 mini or 3 regular waffles
recipeIngredient: 1/4 cup plus 1-2 tablespoons of club soda

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, mix all the dry ingredients - oat flour, almond flour, potato starch, baking powder, salt, and sugar - and mix really well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, mix all the dry ingredients - oat flour, almond flour, potato starch, baking powder, salt, and sugar - and mix really well.

recipeInstructions.text: Then add in the lemon juice, oil, lemon zest. Add in a 1/4 cup of the club soda and mix in. Add in more, 1 tablespoon at a time.
recipeInstructions.name: Then add in the lemon juice, oil, lemon zest. Add in a 1/4 cup of the club soda and mix in. Add in more, 1 tablespoon at a time.

recipeInstructions.text: Let the mixture sit for 2 minutes. It will start to thicken out and you can add more soda accordingly so that you have a pancake-like batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Let the mixture sit for 2 minutes. It will start to thicken out and you can add more soda accordingly so that you have a pancake-like batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Don't add any more club soda for 5 minutes because the batter does thicken a bit more because oat flour will thicken it up. But you don't want too much moisture.
recipeInstructions.name: Don't add any more club soda for 5 minutes because the batter does thicken a bit more because oat flour will thicken it up. But you don't want too much moisture.

recipeInstructions.text: Fold in the blueberries. Prepare your waffle iron by brushing a little bit of oil on it.
recipeInstructions.name: Fold in the blueberries. Prepare your waffle iron by brushing a little bit of oil on it.

recipeInstructions.text: Once heated, add the batter and make your waffles.
